Body.Description: This data type takes holds information about a formatted string.
Body.Label: Formatted Text
Body.Name: FormattedText

TypeDefinition.Description: The content type of the request. Currently supports JSON and Text.
TypeDefinition.Label: Content Type
TypeDefinition.Name: ContentType

TypeDefinition.Description: The content of the formatted text that can spawn multiple lines.
TypeDefinition.Label: Text
TypeDefinition.Name: Text

Body.Description: The types of values that can be extracted from API responses in IO Generic API tasks.
Body.Label: Response Parameter Type
Body.Name: ResponseParameterTypeEnum

TypeDefinition.Description: The types of values that can be extracted from API responses in IO Generic API tasks. The JSON type can be used to extract any type of value from response as a parameter.
TypeDefinition.Label: Parameter Type
TypeDefinition.Name: ParameterType

Body.Description: This data type takes information about a parameter that needs to be extracted from an API response in Generic API tasks.
Body.Label: Response Parameter
Body.Name: ResponseParameter

TypeDefinition.Description: The content specific path information that identifies the parameter value within the content. The value is usually a XPath or JSONPath or a regular expression in case of text content.
TypeDefinition.Label: Path
TypeDefinition.Name: Path

TypeDefinition.Description: The response parameter type - will be one of string, integer, float, boolean, complex or collection. If the type is not specified, parameter will be considered of string type by default.
TypeDefinition.Label: Type
TypeDefinition.Name: Type

Body.Description:
Response parser framework supports extraction of required values from API/device responses. These responses may be of various content types such as XML, JSON, etc. The values of importance are modeled as parameters in the response parser framework.
The parameters can be of a scalar value type or a collection of values. A group of related parameters can be modeled as a single complex type parameter. These complex types will be very useful to extract a set of repeating group of related parameters.
A response parser specification defines the set of parameters that need to be extracted from the content. The response parser specification allows complex type definitions to be defined for any complex parameters.
Body.Label: Response Parser
Body.Name: ResponseParserType

TypeDefinition.Description: The collection of parameters that need to be extracted from the API response.
TypeDefinition.Label: Parameters
TypeDefinition.Name: Parameters

Body.Description: The outcome type specifies status of the task to be set when the outcome condition evaluates to true.
Body.Label: Outcome Type Enum
Body.Name: OutcomeTypeEnum

TypeDefinition.Description: The outcome type specifies status of the task to be set when the outcome condition evaluates to true.
TypeDefinition.Label: Outcome Type
TypeDefinition.Name: OutcomeType

Body.Description:
Intersight Orchestrator allows the users to specify the different API outcomes.
The task status message for an outcome can be specified. An outcome can be qualified as recoverable/non-recoverable error condition.
Body.Label: Outcome
Body.Name: Outcome

TypeDefinition.Description: The user friendly name given to the task outcome.
TypeDefinition.Label: Name
TypeDefinition.Name: Name

TypeDefinition.Description:
The condition expression that uses a golang template logical expression to mark this outcome when the condition evaluates to true for the task execution.
The condition can refer outputs extracted via the response parser. The format to refer the captured output is {{.local.response.<captured-parameter-name>}}.
Lets say we have defined 'Name' in the response parser specification and in the condition we want to check if the extracted output 'Name' equals to string value 'Test', condition looks like - {{eq .local.response.Name "Test"}}. Make sure to enclose the value within double quotes if it is of string datatype.
TypeDefinition.Label: Condition
TypeDefinition.Name: Condition

TypeDefinition.Description:
The message to be shown when the outcome specified by condition occurs. Message can have references to the response
parser captured output.
TypeDefinition.Label: Message
TypeDefinition.Name: Message

TypeDefinition.Description:
The outcome type based on which task status is updated accordingly. Following outcome types are defined. 1. Success              - Indicates that the outcome is a success and task execution status is marked as 'success'.
2. Error                - Indicates that the outcome is an error and task execution status is marked as 'failed'.
3. Skip Task Execution  - Indicates that the task needs to be skipped based on the condition specified and
                          mark the execution status as 'NO_OP'.
TypeDefinition.Label: Type of the outcome
TypeDefinition.Name: Type

Body.Description: Invokes the given Web API against the given endpoint. The endpoint can be Intersight API or an external endpoint added as Target in Intersight. Please refer Supported Endpoints section in the Web API request end user documentation for the list of Intersight Targets on which Web API task can be invoked.
Body.Label: Invoke Web API Request
Body.Name: InvokeGenericWebApi

InputDefinition.Description: The API call can be made to Intersight or an external endpoint added as Target. Target should be in claimed or connected state. Please refer Supported Endpoints section in the Web API request end user documentation for the list of Intersight Targets on which Web API task can be invoked. An empty value for this input indicates that the API call is made to Intersight.
InputDefinition.Label: External Target
InputDefinition.Name: Target

Properties.Selector: /api/v1/asset/Targets?$filter=((TargetType eq HTTPEndpoint and Status eq Claimed) or ((TargetType eq PureStorageFlashArray or TargetType eq HitachiVirtualStoragePlatform or TargetType eq NetAppActiveIqUnifiedManager or TargetType eq TerraformCloud or TargetType eq VmwareVcenter or TargetType eq APIC or TargetType eq MDSDevice or TargetType eq NexusDevice or TargetType eq UCSD or TargetType eq RedfishServer or TargetType eq UCSC890) and Status eq Connected))

InputDefinition.Description: HTTP method to be requested on the given URL. If the value is not given, GET is used as default.
InputDefinition.Label: Method
InputDefinition.Name: Method

InputDefinition.Description: Relative URL for Intersight, Device Registration and Target APIs. Does not support specifying fully qualified URL.
InputDefinition.Label: URL
InputDefinition.Name: Url

InputDefinition.Description: The request headers that need to be sent in the request in key value pairs list.
InputDefinition.Label: Headers
InputDefinition.Name: Headers

InputDefinition.Description: The key value pairs given in this input will be sent in HTTP 'Cookie' header.
InputDefinition.Label: Cookies
InputDefinition.Name: Cookies

InputDefinition.Description: The type of the response. Currently supports JSON.
InputDefinition.Label: Response Type
InputDefinition.Name: ContentType

InputDefinition.Description: The optional request body that is sent as part of this API request. The request body can contain golang templates that can be populated with task input parameters and previous API output parameters.
InputDefinition.Label: Body
InputDefinition.Name: Body

InputDefinition.Description: The structure of the response parser shall provide the list of values that need to be extracted from the API response.
InputDefinition.Label: Response Parser
InputDefinition.Name: ResponseParser

InputDefinition.Description:
Allows to capture the possible outcomes of this API. This is a collection of outcomes which gets evaluated in the order they are given. If an outcome condition evaluates to 'true', status of the task can be set to one of the supported types - Success, Error or no operation and also an optional task execution message can be set.
At the end of the outcomes list, a catchall success/fail outcome can be added with condition explicitly set as 'true'. This allows to mark the status of task execution either success or failure when none of the previous outcomes match.
When no outcomes is specified, default behaviour is to mark the API execution status 'success' if obtained HTTP status code is 2xx else mark it as 'failed'.
InputDefinition.Label: Outcomes
InputDefinition.Name: Outcomes

OutputDefinition.Description: The response headers that are extracted from the API response.
OutputDefinition.Label: Headers
OutputDefinition.Name: Headers

OutputDefinition.Description: The list of cookies obtained from the response in the form of key value pairs.
OutputDefinition.Label: Cookies
OutputDefinition.Name: Cookies

OutputDefinition.Description: The HTTP status code of the Web API response.
OutputDefinition.Label: Status Code
OutputDefinition.Name: StatusCode

OutputDefinition.Description: The HTTP status message of the Web API response.
OutputDefinition.Label: Status Message
OutputDefinition.Name: StatusMessage

OutputDefinition.Description: The list of output parameters extracted from the response.
OutputDefinition.Label: Parameters
OutputDefinition.Name: Parameters

Tasks.Description: Invokes the given Web API against the given endpoint. The endpoint can be Intersight API or an external endpoint added as Target in Intersight. Please refer Supported Endpoints section in the Web API request end user documentation for the list of Intersight Targets on which Web API task can be invoked.
Tasks.Label: Get Server Serial Number
Tasks.Name: InvokeGenericWebApi1

Tasks.Description: Invokes the given Web API against the given endpoint. The endpoint can be Intersight API or an external endpoint added as Target in Intersight. Please refer Supported Endpoints section in the Web API request end user documentation for the list of Intersight Targets on which Web API task can be invoked.
Tasks.Label: Get Virtual Drives M2
